label: 持明院統
本: From Sovereign to Symbol: An Age of Ritual Determinism in Fourteenth Century Japan . Oxford University Press . 2012
見出し読み: じみょういん とう
説明文: Imperial lineage descended from Go-Fukakusa, a son of Emperor Go-Saga. Go-Fukakusa's descendants, Fushimi, Go-Fushimi, Hanazono, and Kogon, alternated succession to the throne with Daikakuji rivals. Jimyo'in monarchs staffed the Northern Court during the civil war and, after the conclusion of the civil war. continue to occupy the throne. See also the Daikakuji lineage.
